Janet Street-Porter has paid tribute to the late Tara Palmer-Tomkinson - who she “knew very well”. 
The It-girl sadly died aged 45 from a brain tumour yesterday, and the Loose Women panelist remembered her on the ITV show today. 
She said: “I knew Tara because I met her out at parties. 
“She was such a lovely, lovely person, I don’t remember one time where she didn’t make me laugh. 
“She was a bubbly person who lifted up a room.” Read More Tara sadly died yesterday (Photo: ITV) Janet Street Porter paid tribute to her on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) 
Speaking of her well-documented struggle with drugs, Janet continued: “Yes, she had problems with drugs, but, really, she just struggled to live up to the reputation she was given of it girl. 
“She just wanted to find a man and play the piano at home!” 
She added: “I’ll never gorget going out to lunch with her, and we drove down Piccadilly in an open top car. 
“How Tara is that?” Read More She said she lit up a room (Photo: ITV) Tara had been a Loose Women panelist before (Photo: ITV) 
Linda Robson - who was also on the Loose Women panel - competed in Celebrity Fame Academy the same year that Tara won the show. 
And the Birds of a Feather actress said: “She was a lovely person, and she worked so hard. 
“She was so generous, she said to me, ‘Your skin’s a bit dry’, and then came back with all these creams.”
